title: CTRL0000050980 - Transcribed Interview of Kelly Ruh, (February 28, 2022)

data.text: JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL,
The deposition in the above matter was held via Webex, commencing at 2:01 p.m.
For the SELECT COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE
THE JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL:
This is a deposition of Kelly Ruh, conducted by the House Select Committee to
Investigate the January 6th Attack on the United States Capitol pursuant to House
At this time, I'd like the witness to please state her full name and spell her last
And, Counsel, can you please state your full name and spell
your last name for the record as well?
Matthew Fernholz, Fas in "Frank," e-r-n-h-o-1, z as in "zebra."
as an investigative counsel for the select committee.
investigative counsel - a n d also
This will be a staff-led deposition.
they of course may choose to also ask questions.
them join so you both are aware.
If any members of the select committee join,
I will try to announce them as I see
Under the House deposition rules, neither committee members nor staff may
discuss the substance of testimony you provide today unless the committee approves
You and your attorney will have an opportunity to review the transcript, Ms.
Before we begin, I'd like to discuss a few ground rules.
deposition rules that we have provided to you with the subpoena.
There is an official reporter transcribing the record of this deposition.
wait until each question is completed before you begin your response, and we will try to
wait until your response is complete before we ask our next question.
I understand, you know, sometimes with the virtual meetings, people can talk on
top of one another, and that's totally fine.
Please excuse me if I end up interrupting
Sometimes there's a delay in the feedback.
The stenographer cannot record nonverbal responses, such as shaking your head
or nodding your head, so please answer each question with an audible, verbal response.
We ask that you provide complete answers based on your best recollection.
if my question is not clear, which it may not be, please, you know, ask me to clarify, and I
If you do not know the answer, please say so.
You may only refuse to answer a question to preserve a privilege recognized by
may either proceed with the deposition or seek a ruling from the chairman on the
And if you refuse to answer a question based on a privilege, staff
If the chairman overrules such an objection, you are required to answer the
I also want to remind you that it is unlawful to deliberately provide false
deposition is under oath, providing false information could result in criminal penalties for
Would you please stand and raise your right hand to be sworn,
This isn't specific to you; we say this to everyone.
Do you solemnly declare and affirm under the penalty of perjury
that the testimony you are about to give will be the truth, the whole truth, and nothing
And, logistically, please let us know if you need to take a break,
get some water, stretch your legs, or if you would like to discuss anything with your
Ms. Ruh, typically, what we do -- and I think it's worked pretty well -- is, we'll mute
ourselves, turn off the cameras, and then you can talk to your attorney, and then, you
know, put the camera back on and unmute if you're ready to go, to proceed with the
Does that sound okay to you both?
And I think we are getting a little bit of feedback.
I don't know if it's possible,
maybe, Mr. Fernholz, if you could mute yourself, or we can also proceed, but there is,
like, a -- I am hearing the echo I think that you referenced earlier, Mr. Fernholz.
So here's what I'm going to do.
need to chime in with an objection, I'll unmute myself.
witness and the committee on the screen that I need to lodge an objection, just because
there's going to be a delay.
But I'll put myself on mute and see if that solves the
that you have an opportunity to state your objections.
from you just because you're on mute.
I may have to indicate to the
I don't want to take that away
With that, anyone have -- do you have any questions, or are you ready to
So let's put up exhibit 1, please,-·
I believe this is the subpoena that was issued to you, Ms. Ruh.
understand that you are appearing pursuant to the subpoena dated January 28, 2022?
And can you see that okay, the exhibit?
And you are the Kelly Ruh listed in the subpoena shown in exhibit
And so part of the subpoena requires you to produce documents and information,
Can you briefly describe for us the efforts that you took to comply with the
I went through my personal email.
I have a couple email accounts,
so I searched all of those accounts, as well as my cell phone, utilizing
keyword-search-type functions for the date range specified in the subpoena.
was sent to you is what was recovered in those searches.
And during the relevant time period, did you only use one cell phone?
In terms of messaging applications, like Signal, WhatsApp, Telegram,
did you search any of those applications, to the extent you used them?
I don't recall that I had any of those at that time.
What about social media, such as Facebook, Twitter, lnstagram,
Did you use any of those types of social media during the relevant time period?
I did look through what messages might have been -- or were in Facebook,
but that didn't -- anything that was found in there was submitted.
And what about electronically stored documents, such as
documents saved on a computer or iPad?
And to the extent you had any hard-copy documents, hard-copy
notes, did you search for that?
I did look through files, yes.
Did you coordinate with any members of President Trump's 2020 campaign,
President Trump's lawyers, anyone at the RNC or the Wisconsin GOP in connection with
How about in connection with responding to any of the document
And have you produced to the select committee all of the
documents and communications in your possession, custody, or control that are
responsive to the request in the subpoena?
So let's just start a bit with your background.
I live in De Pere, Wisconsin.
And do you want to spell it, maybe, for the record?
And can you just give us a brief overview of your professional background?
How long have you lived in Wisconsin?
Lifelong -- what's -- is it Wisconsian or Wisconsinite?
So, out of college, I was a tax accountant for a
public accounting firm; and then progressed into industry, so manufacturing, as staff
accountant, senior accountant, controller, assistant controller.
And I think I read that you currently work for BayView Industries.
It's a company by the name of SD Wheel, Sas in "Sam," Das in "dog," Wheel.
Did you ever work for BayView Industries?
That employment ceased in July of 2021.
So where do you currently work?
So when did you work there?
And are you currently a member of the De Pere City Council?
You were a Republican Party elector for the 2020 Presidential election.
Do you recall how you were selected?
Was that your first time serving as an elector in a Presidential
Can you please tell us how you recall -- what you recall about how
you were selected to be a Republican Party elector for the 2020 election?
So, as the, you know, election cycle was in swing and the time for
selecting electors was happening, the State party informed district chairmen, really, how
So, in the State of Wisconsin, obviously, with 10 electoral votes, the way
they -- my understanding and what they explained to us was that they would take one
representative or, really, the district chairman from each of the eight congressional
So Wisconsin is divided into eight congressional districts.
And so they take the eight congressional districts, plus then most likely the party
chairman, and then either an RNC Committeeman or Committeewoman.
group of 10 makes up the slate of electors.
And which congressional district do you chair?
Prior to election day, what was your understanding of your role as a Republican
That there would be a date specified to attend a signing of documents at the
And did you have an understanding as to what date -- what the date was?
Did you have an understanding that you may not have to sign documents on
I just want to object to form on the last
Did you understand that there would be an instance where you would not
have to sign documents on December 14th in your role as a Republican Party elector?
If Donald Trump did not win the State of Wisconsin.
Prior to election day, was it your understanding that you would only cast your
electoral vote if President Trump won the popular vote of Wisconsin?
Do you recall the basis of your understanding?
Do you recall where you understood that you would only cast your electoral
vote if President Trump won the popular vote of Wisconsin?
And I'll just object to form on the question.
Ms. Ruh, do you understand my question?
Do you recall where your understanding came from as to that you
would only cast an electoral vote if President Trump won the popular vote of Wisconsin
I would say that that would just be an understanding acquired over many
years volunteering in politics or understanding just the process in general.
Are you familiar with a news publication called The Atlantic?
Before election day, do you remember hearing an idea that the Trump campaign
may try to have Republican Party electors chosen in a State even if President Trump had
not won the popular vote in that State?
Before election day, do you remember hearing an idea that the
Trump campaign for 2020 may try to have the Republican Party electors chosen in a State
even if President Trump had not won the popular vote in that State?
Before election day, do you remember hearing any discussions within the
Wisconsin Republican Party or elsewhere that the Trump campaign in 2020 may try to
have the Republican Party electors appointed through the legislature even if President
Trump had not won the popular vote in that State?
Prior to election day, had you heard that there could be rival, or what I'll call
alternate, slates of electors that could cast electoral votes and send those to the
president of the Senate, where it would be up to the president of the Senate to decide
For these questions, are you referring to Wisconsin specifically or
It's a general question, just if she had heard of the concept.
Counselor, if I can just jump in real quick.
I'm not -- I think you're muted on Ms. Ruh's.
sorry, we're -- we were going back and forth and I didn't hear.
It was not specific to Wisconsin.
general question, if she had heard of the idea anywhere prior to election day.
I understand that it's been a while, but when do you recall first hearing discussions
about a potential meeting to cast electoral votes for the Republican Party candidates for
President and Vice President in Wisconsin?
Like, when we were -- can you repeat that?
When do you first recall hearing discussions about a potential
meeting to cast electoral votes for the Republican Party candidates for President
Trump -- for President and Vice President, in this case Donald Trump and Mike Pence?
If I can just make a request for clarification.
the general process worked before election day, or are you being specific, after election
Well, the question is just when she heard the first -- for the first
I think it would be after election day, but my question is, for the first time you
ever recalled hearing discussions about a potential meeting to cast electoral votes for the
Republican -- let me rephrase for clarity.
So, after election day, Ms. Ruh, when did you first hear discussions about a
potential meeting in Wisconsin to cast electoral votes for the Republican Party candidates
I believe that was in early December.
That was a text message, I believe, that I had received that was putting me
What do you recall about those discussions?
on notice that I may still need to attend the meeting on December 14th in the event that
Donald Trump would be declared the winner of Wisconsin after going through various
So we can pull up exhibit 2, which -- this is a compilation of text messages
that you've produced to us, Ms. Ruh.
It doesn't have a Bates number.
And let's go to page 23, and I'll give you some time to review it.
If you can go up a bit?
So this is a text message chain with Mark Jefferson from December 3, 2020.
Can you see that, Ms. Ruh?
Is this the text message that you were referring to as a potential meeting --
Mark Jefferson is the executive director of the Republican Party of
If you want to take a second to review it to refresh your recollection.
Do you know why Mr. Jefferson was telling you about this potential meeting
I assume it was because his role as executive director is really to
communicate on the key issues of the party.
very typical for him to communicate directly with district chairmen.
It's not atypical for him -- I should say, it's
If you read that first message from Mr. Jefferson on December 3rd, I think at 12:35
p.m., he says, "Given all of the court cases pending we were advised to reach out to the
Do you know who the "we" is in that sentence?
Do you know what the advice was?
Calls for speculation to another witness receiving
If you can answer, Ms. Ruh, go ahead and do so.
Yeah, I'm just asking if you knew, whether or not you knew what the advice
Mr. Jefferson says at the end of his message, "Confidentially."
Do you know -- he references "we were advised."
Calls for her to speculate about another
If you can answer, go ahead.
I assume, like -- I assume that was strictly security-related.
Can you explain what you mean by "security-related"?
I knew from talking to people who had served as 2016 electors that they had
received many threatening -- perhaps not threatening -- whether it was harassing,
threatening, you know, not-so-friendly emails, letters in the mail, things like that -- that
there were security concerns about traveling to and from the capitol on December 14th.
So I believe at the time my assumption on that was purely security-related.
You respond to that message, "I figured.
What did you mean by "it's still on the calendar"?
I believe I had put in for a day off, scheduled a personal time-off day through
my employer, and I had not canceled that request as of yet, at that time.
Do you recall whether there was any other reason why you thought that you
might still need to meet on December 14th?
Around the date -- around the time of these text messages, which is December
3rd, did you have any understanding as to what the status of any litigation was in
I knew there were cases that were ongoing, but I was not in the -- aware of
Did you have any understanding as to whether any -- whether President
Trump or Joe Biden had been certified as the winners of the State of Wisconsin?
Let's go to -- this is the same exhibit, but let's go to -- oh, actually, keep on page
from December 11th, and you write, "Are we truly going to Madison monday?"
If you look a little bit further down -- it's a little hard for me to see -- I believe it's
Do you recall why you were asking whether you were truly going to
There had been no communication to confirm that our presence was still
needed on December 14th, so I sent this text to try to understand if I was still needed in
If not, I was going to, obviously, report to work that day.
Had you had any communications with the other Republican Party electors
up to December 11, 2020, the day of this text?
And you said you had not received any communications up to this point.
Had you been told anything about, like, logistical planning for December 14th?
Do you recall who provided you with information about where to meet on
I believe it was Mark Jefferson.
And did Mr. Jefferson ever tell you about how the meeting on December
Did anyone ever tell you how the meeting on December 14th would
I believe I had talked to some people who had served as electors in 2016 to

I believe it was Bill Berglund.
vice chair of the Eighth Congressional District.
I believe I had asked him what his experience was from doing that in 2016.
And he had served on that role -- or in
And, obviously, we work together, or volunteer together, quite a bit.
Do you recall what Mr. Berglund told you about his experience being in
You go to the capitol and you sign papers.
Do you recall speaking to any other prior electors in connection with the
Did you end up meeting with other Republican Party electors on December 14th
to cast purported electoral votes for President Trump and Vice President Pence?
Did you rely on any advice in connection with your decision to meet with and

And, Counsel, if you can specify what you mean and maybe be a
little more specific in the question.
Did anyone provide you any advice in connection with the -- in connection
with the December 14th meeting in Wisconsin at the capitol?
All I really had was what you showed in the exhibit from Mark Jefferson.
There was nothing more than that.
At the time that you met on December 14th with the other Republican Party
electors, were you aware of any other similar meetings that were occurring in other
States involving Republican Party electors, such as Arizona, Georgia, Michigan, Nevada,
Did you have any concerns about meeting on December 14th to cast
purported electoral votes in connection with the 2020 election?
Any concerns about meeting, specifically meeting and casting
And I'll have the same objection.
Just any sort of -- I think it's pretty -- I think I'm pretty clear, Ms. Ruh, if you
I had concerns for my physical safety.
That was the only concern I had.
And can you explain what you mean by "physical safety"?
Simply, you know, it's a very divisive -- or was a very divided election
day to, you know, getting up to December 14th, I was just concerned about, as a female
especially, traveling to and from the capitol, getting in and out of the building safely,
And based on what we had seen just in the time from election
Prior to the meeting on December 14, 2020, did any other Republican Party
electors ever express any concerns that they had about the meeting, about security or
She had served in 2016 as an elector and had expressed
concerns for physical safety, about getting to and from the capitol, in and out of the
And do you recall who expressed those concerns to you about physical
Prior to the December 14th meeting, to your knowledge, did you talk to
anyone associated with the Trump campaign about the December 14th meeting?
Prior to the December 14th meeting, to your knowledge, did you
communicate with anyone in the White House about the December 14 meeting?
I'm going to turn to exhibit 4.
And, Ms. Ruh, this is not a document that
you produced to us, so you can take a second to review it.
And I'm not going to ask you detailed questions about it, because I'm not sure
you've even seen this document before.
Do you recall ever reviewing this document in connection with the

Do you know -- in the "TO" line, it says "James R. Troupis."
Do you know whether Mr. Chesebro or Mr. Troupis had any
involvement in the December 14th electoral college meeting in Wisconsin?
I'm going to turn to exhibit -BY
know who James R. Troupis is?
It says it's from someone named Kenneth
So I guess my first question is, do you
Before we turn off of that, you say you now know who Mr. Troupis is.
did you learn about Mr. Troupis?
His name I believe was in the subpoena.
You haven't -- have you talked to him since December 14, 2020?
Have you talked to any other alternate electors about Mr. Troupis or
Mr. Chesebro since that meeting on December 14th?
We'll turn to exhibit 5, and there will be a similar question.
So take a second, Ms. Ruh, to review it.
Do you recall reviewing this memorandum in connection with the December
Do you recall ever hearing anyone reference a memorandum from a
-- in connection with the December 14th meeting?
Going into December 14th, did you have any expectations about how the day
I was told everybody was meeting at the Republican Party of Wisconsin
office in Madison, and, from there, we would be taken to the capitol.
So my goal was to get to the office on time, and then, from there, the
rest -- transportation, where to park -- was handled by the party.
That was my understanding and expectation for the day.
We'll go back to exhibit 2, the compilation of text messages you produced.
Can you see this, Ms. Ruh, what's on the screen?
And if you go up a little b i t , _ I believe it says "Marian Krumberger,"
Marian is the former chairman of the Brown County Republican Party.
And Brown County, is that in -- excuse me for my ignorance -- is that in
And if you can read that, it says, "I'm being sent to do the electoral vote.
Can you explain your message to Ms. Krumberger?
I was -- you know, for a long time, obviously, had planned to
potentially be in Madison on the 14th, and then, after Biden had won the State, was not
It was a very stressful season at work, which I believed she was well
And so, with, you know, many court cases and things being contested after the
election, after election day, it was looking like, yes, we would be signing these papers as a
backup, you know, on the remote chance that Donald Trump would be declared the
And that was, you know, really -- I was not expecting that to prevail in the courts
and was obviously pissed that I would be using a personal day off to go and complete that
And you mentioned something about a remote chance.
what you meant by it was a remote chance?
Well, I mean, the best outcome would've been for Donald Trump to
have won the popular vote, right, just as a normal election would've happened.
when you get into arguing these things in the courts, my experience, whether it was
business or otherwise, family court, whatever, is just that you don't -- you hope you don't
And with some, you know, issues of fraud being unresolved and things like that,
my personal belief at the time was that the court would not rule to overturn Biden being
So the reference -- your mentioning of "remote chance" is in
In the message below, if you can see that, it says, "Don't mention to anyone - it's
Do you recall why you said "it's hush hush"?
Because I was concerned about physical safety.
something that, I mean, we talked about in previous conversations, you know, even
pre-election-day, just that if I was an elector, you know, physical safety would certainly be
You've already mentioned this a bit, but can you just walk us through December
14th, you know, starting with where you met and how the day proceeded?
So I left my home in the morning, I would think probably 7, 8 o'clock, to get to
headquarters, that parking could be an issue, the parking there is not easy, and so to
make sure we allowed ample time to get our vehicles parked and situated.
We were all told to meet at the Republican Party of Wisconsin's
So I did that, walked into the office.
And, from there, they drove us to the capitol.
Some of the other electors were there;
And when everybody was there, they had SUVs for us to get in.
And do you recall approximately what time you arrived to the capitol
Is it fair to say it was before noon --
Do you remember if you had any issues getting into the capitol
What issues do you recall having getting into the building?
The building was closed to the public because
And so we were -- they dropped us at a couple of
different entrances to see if we could gain access, if there was someone we could talk to
I remained in the vehicle while others tried to arrange for
I believe we were taken to the capitol once and could not get in, and so they drove
us back to the Republican Party of Wisconsin office.
We unloaded, got out of the cars,
sat in a conference room, and then, shortly after, repeated the process of going back to
And then I believe it was a GOP staffer or someone who had let us in or somehow
got access for us to enter the State capitol.
And so, on our second trip, we were able to
Do you recall if you saw press when you arrived at the building on December
At any point on December 14th at the capitol, did you, to your knowledge,
see any of the Democratic Party electors?
Where did you and the other Republican Party electors go once you got into the
It was just a conference room.
And do you recall who was in the conference room with you on December
It was the nine others that were chosen to do this, as well as some various
staffers, or at least I presumed they were Republican Party of Wisconsin staff.
I think there were a few security guards.
Do you recall, to your knowledge, whether there was anyone from the
Trump campaign in that conference room on December 14th?
I understand that you were a secretary for purposes of that December 14th
Did you have any responsibilities as secretary of that meeting?
Did you fill out any paperwork, to the best of your recollection,
There was a document that needed to be signed, because one of the original
electors that was chosen was unable to attend that day for family reasons, and so there
was a change in that -- in appointing a new elector to fill that void.
And was that called something like a vacancy certificate, to the best of your
I'm going to pull up exhibit 6.
I believe this is also something that you
Are you able to see that?
So this is entitled "Certificate of the Votes of the 2020 Electors from
And if you go to page 2 a bit, the second page has all these signatures.
Do you recall signing this document on December 14th?
If you go to page 1, you can see this language.
undersigned, being the duly elected and qualified Electors for President and Vice

Do you recall whether you had any discussions about changing this language of
the Certificate of the Votes of the 2020 Electors from Wisconsin?
Are you aware that in -- other States who had similar certificates of
Can you walk us through what happened after the meeting on December
Counsel, I'll object, as to overbroad.
-- more specific as to what you're referring to?
After you signed paperwork, what did you do on December 14th?
We were -- the same vehicles that dropped us off picked us up, and we were

Did anyone ever tell you what would happen with the papers that were
Do you know where, if anywhere, those papers went, the signed
Do you recall whether you had any meetings or phone calls with the other

meeting or just phone calls in general?
Did you mean phone calls with them regarding the December 14th
Regarding what had just taken place.

There was a theory that was

Did you ever hear of that theory?
And when did you hear that theory?
I would say, in the weeks leading up to January 6th.
Do you recall who you heard that -- or where you heard that theory?
Discussion on whether or not there were any other legal efforts that could
And what exactly do you recall that you heard?
be taken or within the Constitution to resolve election-related issues.
Can you see that, Ms. Ruh?
She was a middle school teacher that I had.

SEVEN states, Trump victory path clear."
Parallel electors chosen and submitted by

Not sure about anything else though."
And I think we're actually going to have to go down.
Yeah, if you could scroll down.
You can go down a little bit.

Quite honestly, I don't -- she was one who seemed to believe in any and all

that is the response, because I at the time probably didn't actually read 100 percent of

hoping you could explain to us, do you recall what you sent to her?
screenshot of an email, but it's hard to read it.

the subject line is "I like this if it is possible."

Atty. Jenna Ellis," and there's a

I did not expect those votes to be counted.
And are you able to see that, Ms. Ruh?
So it's the compilation of text messages again.
So this is a text message chain with someone named Nancy Schmidt

I would not want to be in his shoes."
Can you explain these messages for us?
I believe I was describing a conversation that I had had with Congressman
Gallagher that morning, in which he in his frequent communication regarding Eighth
District matters at times will call and discuss votes and other issues.
had talked about the pressure he was receiving from conservatives, from Republicans, in

And when you say "overturn electoral votes," are you referring to casting an
Was it your understanding he was referring to casting or making an
